title: Madinat Jumeirah Appoints New Resort Director Of SalesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Madinat Jumeirah Appoints New Resort Director Of Sales Published on : Monday, October 5, 2015
Madinat Jumeirah, the Arabian Resort of Dubai, has announced the appointment of Andy Nightingale as Resort Director of Sales.
Andy brings more than 20 years’ experience from the airline and hospitality industries. He has worked with global companies including InterContinental Hotels, Rotana Hotels and Resorts Virgin Atlantic and other European airlines.
A British national, Andy has been in the Gulf region for nine years. He first worked in Doha and then moved to Dubai six years ago. He joins Madinat Jumeirah from Rotana Hotels and Resorts where he held the position of Corporate Director of Global Sales and witnessed huge growth in their portfolio and international development. He brings a broad and diverse range of sales experience including Global Sales and on property Director of Sales and Marketing.
Andy will be responsible for overseeing the sales strategy for Madinat Jumeirah including the new Jumeirah Al Naseem scheduled to open in 2016.
Madinat Jumeirah is a magnificent tribute to Dubai’s rich heritage and the cultural traditions of the UAE. Showcasing the ultimate in Arabian hospitality, the luxurious resort features two grand boutique hotels Jumeirah Mina A’ Salamand Jumeirah Al Qasr, the traditional summer houses of Jumeirah Dar Al Masyaf, and seven exclusive Malakiya Villas. Located upon 2km of private beach and interconnected by 3km of waterways and lush gardens, Madinat Jumeirah provides extensive leisure facilities including, Talise Fitness health club, over 40 world class restaurants and bars, and bustling souk with 75 boutique shops, and Pacha Ibiza Dubai for the ultimate nightlife experience.
Source:- Jumeirah
